verses.verse: Thus says the LORD: “Behold, a people comes from the (Jer. 1:15; 10:22; 50:41-43) north country, And a great nation will be raised from the farthest parts of the earth.
They will lay hold on bow and spear; They are cruel and have no mercy; Their voice (Is. 5:30) roars like the sea; And they ride on horses, As men of war set in array against you, O daughter of Zion.”
We have heard the report of it; Our hands grow feeble. (Jer. 4:31; 13:21; 49:24) Anguish has taken hold of us, Pain as of a woman in labor.
Do not go out into the field, Nor walk by the way. Because of the sword of the enemy, Fear is on every side.

O daughter of my people, (Jer. 4:8) Dress in sackcloth (Jer. 25:34; Mic. 1:10) And roll about in ashes! (Amos 8:10; (Zech. 12:10)) Make mourning as for an only son, most bitter lamentation; For the plunderer will suddenly come upon us.
“I have set you as an assayer and (Jer. 1:18) a fortress among My people, That you may know and test their way.
(Jer. 5:23) They are all stubborn rebels, (Jer. 9:4) walking as slanderers. They are (Ezek. 22:18) bronze and iron, They are all corrupters;
The bellows blow fiercely, The lead is consumed by the fire; The smelter refines in vain, For the wicked are not drawn off.
People will call them (Is. 1:22; Jer. 7:29) rejected silver, Because the LORD has rejected them.”
Trusting in Lying Words The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
(Jer. 17:19; 26:2) “Stand in the gate of the LORD’s house, and proclaim there this word, and say, ‘Hear the word of the LORD, all you of Judah who enter in at these gates to worship the LORD!’ ”
Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: (Jer. 4:1; 18:11; 26:13) “Amend your ways and your doings, and I will cause you to dwell in this place.
(Jer. 7:8; Mic. 3:11) Do not trust in these lying words, saying, ‘The temple of the LORD, the temple of the LORD, the temple of the LORD are these.’
“For if you thoroughly amend your ways and your doings, if you thoroughly (1 Kin. 6:12; Jer. 21:12; 22:3) execute judgment between a man and his neighbor,
if you do not oppress the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, and do not shed innocent blood in this place, (Deut. 6:14, 15; Jer. 13:10) or walk after other gods to your hurt,
(Deut. 4:40) then I will cause you to dwell in this place, in (Jer. 3:18) the land that I gave to your fathers forever and ever.
“Behold, you trust in (Jer. 5:31; 14:13, 14) lying words that cannot profit.
(1 Kin. 18:21; Hos. 4:1, 2; Zeph. 1:5) Will you steal, murder, commit adultery, swear falsely, burn incense to Baal, and (Ex. 20:3; Jer. 7:6; 19:4) walk after other gods whom you do not know,
(Ezek. 23:39) and then come and stand before Me in this house (Jer. 7:11, 14; 32:34; 34:15) which is called by My name, and say, ‘We are delivered to do all these abominations’?
Has (Is. 56:7) this house, which is called by My name, become a (Matt. 21:13; Mark 11:17; Luke 19:46) den of thieves in your eyes? Behold, I, even I, have seen it,” says the LORD.

“But go now to (Josh. 18:1; Judg. 18:31) My place which was in Shiloh, (Deut. 12:11) where I set My name at the first, and see (1 Sam. 4:10; Ps. 78:60; Jer. 26:6) what I did to it because of the wickedness of My people Israel.

And now, because you have done all these works,” says the LORD, “and I spoke to you, (2 Chr. 36:15; Jer. 11:7) rising up early and speaking, but you did not hear, and I (Prov. 1:24; Is. 65:12; 66:4) called you, but you did not answer,

therefore I will do to the house which is called by My name, in which you trust, and to this place which I gave to you and your fathers, as I have done to (1 Sam. 4:10, 11; Ps. 78:60; Jer. 26:6, 9) Shiloh.
And I will cast you out of My sight, (2 Kin. 17:23) as I have cast out all your brethren— (Ps. 78:67; Hos. 7:13; 9:13; 12:1) the whole posterity of Ephraim.
“Therefore (Ex. 32:10; Deut. 9:14; Jer. 11:14) do not pray for this people, nor lift up a cry or prayer for them, nor make intercession to Me; (Jer. 15:1) for I will not hear you.
Do you not see what they do in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?

(Jer. 44:17) The children gather wood, the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead dough, to make cakes for the queen of heaven; and they (Jer. 19:13) pour out drink offerings to other gods, that they may provoke Me to anger.
(Deut. 32:16, 21) Do they provoke Me to anger?” says the LORD. “Do they not provoke themselves, to the shame of their own faces?”

Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “Behold, My anger and My fury will be poured out on this place—on man and on beast, on the trees of the field and on the fruit of the ground. And it will burn and not be quenched.”
Thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: (Is. 1:11; Jer. 6:20; Hos. 8:13; Amos 5:21, 22) “Add your burnt offerings to your sacrifices and eat meat.
(1 Sam. 15:22; Ps. 51:16; (Hos. 6:6)) For I did not speak to your fathers, or command them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, concerning burnt offerings or sacrifices.

But this is what I commanded them, saying, (Ex. 15:26; 16:32; Deut. 6:3) ‘Obey My voice, and ((Ex. 19:5, 6); Lev. 26:12; (Jer. 11:4; 13:11)) I will be your God, and you shall be My people. And walk in all the ways that I have commanded you, that it may be well with you.’

(Ps. 81:11; Jer. 11:8) Yet they did not obey or incline their ear, but (Deut. 29:19; Jer. 9:14) followed the counsels and the dictates of their evil hearts, and (Jer. 32:33) went backward and not forward.

Since the day that your fathers came out of the land of Egypt until this day, I have even (2 Chr. 36:15; Jer. 25:4; 29:19; Mark 12:1-10; Luke 11:47-49) sent to you all My servants the prophets, daily rising up early and sending them.
